instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the battery’s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange charging issues
threads.message:
I’m stuck, need some advice please. This board works fine on charger with no battery installed. 
With a charged battery and no charger it also boots and works fine. 
When battery is installed and you plug charger in, the icon says not charging the battery briefly then shows no charger connected, light flashes constantly until battery removed. Light then shows green then orange. 

Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>

Changed a whole bunch of resistors around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> that were marginally out of spec and probably didn’t need changing.

pins 27/28 measure 20ohms
pins 17/18 measure 2.6ohms
voltage at pin 2,19 and 20 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
tried new battery
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> pin 5 is 16.1v no battery connected. Is 7.4v with battery 
<RESISTOR>R5422</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5431</RESISTOR> in spec
acok is 3.4v

Any advice appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange charging issues
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> pin 5 is 16.1v no battery connected. Is 7.4v with battery"
So F7140 has 16V on charger only...
Seems that high-side MOSFET from <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> is shorted.
When you connect battery <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> is blocked.
Be sure pin24/<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is correctly soldered and <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> is in place.

Did you surelly soldered P-channel in place of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>???
Check if is not shorted now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange charging issues
threads.message:
Yes f7140 has 16v on charger 
I just replaced <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> anyway 
On <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> I have continuity from pins 2/3/4/9 to pin 10. This isn’t correct is it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange charging issues
threads.message: Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> again. Don’t have the continuinty to pin 10 anymore. F7140 is only 2v tho so I have something pulling it down I suppose.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange charging issues
threads.message: And now <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> has shorted to ground again. Going round in circles.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> strange charging issues
threads.message: POS is fixed. Was either <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> or I haven’t been putting <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> on properly. What a nightmare. Over 4hrs spent
